website_summaries.verdict: If you are looking for a relatively inexpensive way to start surveillance in your home, this choice is a good value for the money.
pros: Includes a slot for an SD memory card
Price very good for all the options on this dome camera
cons: Other cameras offer a higher resolution

customer_reviews.title: Best cameras for any purpose!
customer_reviews.text: I have using this brand for a bit over 6 years now, and I never had to go back by warranty to sites where I have installed this cameras. Only configuration which is perfectly can be done remotely without visiting sites. This camera controls are very simplified and intuitive what you can do from NVR the same thing can be done via app on your phone which is a great thing. I would definitely recommend this brand for CCTV installers. I've been tracking their product for awhile now and always try their newest things including their 8M camera which is great. Additionally they have MicroSD card slot so even you loose internet connectivity you probably won't loose footage.
customer_reviews.author: Rustam

customer_reviews.title: Night Vision is superb
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in conjunction with some more expensive dome cams. The night vision is phenomenal which really surprised me! Compared to my dome cams which suffer with IR reflections this thing really shines. Day picture is stellar and the POE functionality made wiring easy and super clean. FTP function is great, not even using the SD card so I have all my videos in one place. The web app is, well the web app, but it's not terrible. The mounting system is odd and feels a bit flimsy with the exterior being metal and the actual mount points being plastic. I'd definitely pay another $15 for this exact same camera with metal mounts.
customer_reviews.author: TonyTony

customer_reviews.title: Great wide angle PoE Camera.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on recommendation from a Youtuber in the smart home niche by the name of "The Hook Up" and wasn't disappointed. Mounting and adjusting the camera was fairly easy. WebUI is flash-based so not HTML5 but it least it isn't ActiveX. The picture is as expected, no issue with my PoE switch. Been running for 3 weeks now with weekly reboots and haven't had any issues. Can't speak to the Reolink recording or monitoring software as I just push the feed to my NVR, ivideon, which I highly recommend. It's free with optional upgrades if you want cloud backup and way better than much pricer NVR options like blue iris.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Lue

customer_reviews.title: No Reolink NVR....No Control!
customer_reviews.text: I give this camera one star because you can only use their NVR.....and I have amcrest. It's too bad because the picture quality is awesome!! If you're not using a reolink nvr, this will not work for you but if you're thinking of connecting it some other way then you will very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Botanique Baron Samedi

customer_reviews.title: Good picture, motion alerts useless
customer_reviews.text: Overall, the camera has a good picture quality but if you're planning to mount it outdoors - good luck getting the email alerts set up. Even with sensitivity set to the lowest level the motion alarm is triggered every 30 seconds with the shadow of the tree moving in your set area of detection. On partly cloudy days, the same motion sensor is triggered by the sun going behind the clouds or coming back out as the brightness in the lens of the camera is changing and that alone is enough to set it off. So unless you're using it indoors, or you don't plan to use the motion alerts, don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Igor Lemajic

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend as an motion alert security camera.
customer_reviews.text: With camera set to the lowest possible sensitivity setting I get numerous false alarms all day long! About all it's good for is as a remote camera only.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Files

customer_reviews.title: Freezes, Stutters.....Unusable
customer_reviews.text: I bought the bullet as well as the dome version. Both freeze and stutter. Other cameras from Amcrest and dahua on the same network do not and are working fine. I am returning these. A shame because picture quality was fine and they look good.
customer_reviews.author: tayyib

customer_reviews.title: Don't work properly over RTSP (tinyCam)
customer_reviews.text: Camera doesn't stream properly over RTSP to several platforms like tinyCam App. the snapshot URL they provide also throws errors and doesn't work all the time. They said the problem is in my network, when that's impossible since the cables all passed testing and there's cameras from other brands in the network. DO NOT buy if you plan to use these features.
customer_reviews.author: Ignacio Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Single camera orders shipping with a 3 ft length of CAT cable, usless!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a ReoLink system that came with four cameras, the NVR and four (approx 100ft) lengths of CAT cable. I then ordered a fifth ReoLink 5MP PoE camera and it was shipped with a 3 ft. length of CAT cable, useless for any type of install. The ReoLink NVR and cameras are very good quality and work right out of the box, but why they are shipping a 3 ft length of for a camera is ridiculous and useless.
customer_reviews.author: RE Sturcke

customer_reviews.title: Good camera... Good price...
customer_reviews.text: Picture quality is clear. It is very easy to install. My only concern is that you only twist the camera to lock it unlike the old design where they have screws to lock the camera. It is very easy to steal this camera so make sure to install it where people can’t reach it. Other than that, I still like this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Allan

customer_reviews.title: Cannot connect to cloud!
customer_reviews.text: The app let me buy a cloud monitoring subscription after I registered both cameras. I then discovered these cannot connect to their cloud (only NVR). I'm not a computer guy - don't want to increase my self-IT responsibilities. Just want cloud solution. They should not sell cloud service to someone whose hardware can't support it. This goes beyond "buyer beware" in today's tech world. Should not be incumbent on me to know all of details about cloud/NVR, etc. App should warn buyer that buyer's hardware will not support cloud storage.
customer_reviews.author: thor markwood

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: Camera works well.. Picture quality is pretty good. Night vision works but looks “white washed” It’s very sensitive to movement. I have continually dropped the sensitivity. Still trying to find a happy medium. I don’t want a leaf blowing by to set it off 😂 This does not have PTZ, only manual adjustment. You do have to purchase a POE adapter. I changed all of my security cameras to Reolink. It’s easy to setup. Their app makes it very simple. I did have a small playback issue where the videos weren’t being saved correctly. Turns out the SD card was going bad. Purchased a new SD card and all is good!
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Nicastro

customer_reviews.title: Problematic hookup - if there was a "connector design" rating I would give that 2 stars
customer_reviews.text: Unit works well, but the claim the RJ45 connector housing is waterproof is nothing short of blatant misrepresentation. Futhermore, the audio out and reset buttons on pigtail have no waterproofing. Great if you are drilling a big hole; problematic if mounting outside and want a hole just big enough for a Cat 5e/6/7 cable. Lots of hacks on youtube about how to work around this which seems to be common with all cameras at this price point as well as some very expen$ive one$.
customer_reviews.author: Mini Schnauzer Lover

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: PoE works great, easy configuration, RTSP and Onvif compatible. My biggest complaint is the web interface when you are first setting the camera up - straight from 2003 and requires Flash to view the live image. I have several cameras tied to a Shinobi NVR, it takes some tuning to get the motion detection right but seems to work well. I like them so much I bought two more of them for more coverage! I don't completely trust cheap devices that plug into my network so I have them in their own VLAN with very limited access to my network and no access to the Internet.
customer_reviews.author: B. Snelgrove

customer_reviews.title: Keeps resetting itself
customer_reviews.text: I setup the RLC-520 camera with no problems. Each day when I go into the Reolink app it shows the camera as offline with the error wrong/incorrect password. When I tap on the image of the camera it goes into the initialization process and allows me to assign a password and then it is good for another day. Details on camera model and firware version: RLC-520 build 20071012 IPC_51516M5M v3.0.0.0 v3.0.0.65_20071012 IPC_51516M5M110000000100000 v1.0.261
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Motion detection is useless
customer_reviews.text: Picture quality is good. Where this camera fails and fails big, is motion detection. You will have so many false alerts that you will have to turn the alerts off. I have 5 Reolink cameras and they all blow up your phone with false alerts. Try changing the sensitivity and use the masking feature and it will not change a thing. If you are recording 24/7 it will be fine, but if motion detection is important, buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Mike T

customer_reviews.title: good camera and good price
customer_reviews.text: I first test one of RLC-420-5MP for like a month, and I love it and then i add 3 more. I use POE switch and micro SD without DVR. This setup look very neat: - just one single Ethernet cable to camera - 64GB micro SD put inside the camera itself I am all set, i remote in all my camera, playback with audio, just using my iphone. Because the price is reachable, I plan to add more just for fun to see thing around the house
customer_reviews.author: Sokmeta Leang

customer_reviews.title: bubbled view
customer_reviews.text: This has a little bubble view but not like a fish eyed lens. Throws on the aspect ratio a little but tight package and slick mount. Almost not noticeable . I have several Reolink camera's and like the look of this one the best but the picture the least because of how it a bubble view. I scored 4 on motion detection because you go from setting it off over sunlight causing it to go off to not going off for a 6 year old grandson in the same grid with a slight change. The software is good but I have had issues finding both spots to change the record file location. Why not only one???
customer_reviews.author: Robert Suffecool

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to configure using their powerful app. ONVIF protocol compatible with my NVR.
customer_reviews.text: Initial impressions are great for this camera. Quality seems good and was very impressed with the Reolink app which allowed me to quickly access and view the camera. The app didn't allow me customize the IP Address but I was able to open an Internet browser to the IP address listed in the app. Then I was able to change the DHCP setting to Static and assigned the IP Address that I wanted to the camera with ease. Another great functionality is that it is ONVIF compliant. Since it supports the ONVIF protocol on port 8000, I was able to easily add the camera to my surveillance Network Video Recorder (NVR). Awesome value.
customer_reviews.author: DameonZ

customer_reviews.title: Used a lot of POE cameras, this is the best one by a lot
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, various Poe options 48v direct and 802.3af. Nice wide angle lens. Records/streams at a high FPS. Has all the necessary features without any of the extra junk. Waterproof. Great detail in the picture. Rtsp easy to use. I’m using these with SecuritySpy, had them working almost immediately after unboxing. Only negative is they do not stream as far as I know in h.265, and the web viewer uses flash which isn’t important to me as I’m using software to connect to them. Hopefully though reolink will update both items in a new firmware.
customer_reviews.author: zbooks

customer_reviews.title: Descent camera but expect lots of false notifications.
customer_reviews.text: I like having a camera on my porch. I don't like getting massive amounts of false notifications. Every time a cloud passes in front of the sun my driveway and everything else on the ground lights up on the camera and sends a notification. Multiple notifications over and over for 3 to 4 hours during the day. It's right when my mail and packages come so I cannot just shut them off during those hours. Setting up the motion detection area is no help either because I'm not going to block out my entire front yard from detection.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the value
customer_reviews.text: This camera was very easy to install and configure, as long as you use the ReoLink tool. I placed this camera over my front door. My old camera had a dome and at night all I could see was IR Bounce back. This was due to the lens pointing almost straight down. This camera has a wider field of view even at a distance of 8 feet. The picture is clear in the day as well as at night. It connected into my security system with a few clicks. I'm considering replacing my older camera with this model.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Palombo

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and great picture quality.
customer_reviews.text: Used a POE switch, have 4 of these cameras and for the price they are well worth it. Night vision and overall picture is crisp and clear. Motion detection takes a little tweaking but for outside cameras you can expect that. I have 64gb SD cards in each cam.... More than enough. The mobile app works great and the client is easy to use also, it records also as a nice back up. U may have to be a little computer savvy to set disk space limits and what drive you want to record to.. but it really is a breeze. Been two months now... No issues.
customer_reviews.author: Lajoba

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad camera
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Better than the Swann cameras / system I had. I wanted to add a couple extra cams to my Swann system but there was only one camera that would work with my swann system which was discontinued, so I replaced with a complete Reolink system. The only thing that keeps it from going to a five star is the night vision is just slightly better than my previous camera. Another thing that I find annoying is there is no fast forward when replaying. But thats for the Reolink NVR that I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: FLS Slim guy

customer_reviews.title: Great Picture quality
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 cameras with NVR. Camera quality is great, audio pickup is great. Had a problem with neighbor dog defecating and urinating in my yard. Asked neighbor politely to keep his dog out my hard and he refused. The camera's caught neighbor's dog in my yard. I called Animal Control, he was issued a $50 ticket because I showed him the video. A couple of days later, dog in my yard again, called Animal Control and he was issued a $150 ticket. Next ticket was going to be $500 and the dog hasn't been in my yard for over a month. Also can view camera's on cell phone, tablet, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Emeral

customer_reviews.title: Great video quality
customer_reviews.text: I have both the 4mp and now the 5mp, picture quaility is really good. I have had the 5mp running for a few months now and it's performing well. It's connected to an NVR to record from reolink as well, just ,are sure when you set it up to use the same password.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Great Item to add to your IP video defense
customer_reviews.text: I strongly suggest for anyone who has a DYI home video surveillance investment to think our of the box and make sure your system is a mix of different camera devices. I added the Reolink PoE to my system because of it's video quality, compatible with most ip camera protocol systems, and provides the OPTION TO RECORD to a SSD memory card with-in the camera self. This option added to a system helps PROTECT your system with ADDITIONAL recording devices in case a breach allows the perpetrator time to remove the master recording device. Something to think about !!!!!
customer_reviews.author: gp.btr

customer_reviews.title: Amazing customer service!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: After writing the original review I was contacted by REOLINK customer service and they offered to allow a return even though I had missed the return period (My own fault). I was amazed at how they handled this and can only compliment them on their offer and how easy they worked the process of returning this camera out. Thank you REOLINK for the excellent customer service. This camera is junk to me. The camera did not work with my NVR and even the downloadable Reolink client would not recognize the camera at all. I did not discover this until after the 30 day return period and that is my fault so I will just have to eat the loss.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great IP PoE camera!
customer_reviews.text: These are great cameras. I have both the 'inside' (non-dome) and outside (dome) ones. Both types are phenomenal. I do not use the Reolink app. I directly access the cameras via HTTP(S), and other vendors seem to have issues with this (they require some browser plugin). I also use an app on my iPhone to view the cameras from outside the home, and the cameras work great there. I also have a centralized IP Camera app (Blue Iris) to capture and store recorded images and it immediately recognized the Reolink cameras. So all thumbs-up!
customer_reviews.author: Neil Lovering

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: The cameras work OK and seem to be a good value for the price. Not much else to say at this point. The picture quality is adequate for what I use them for: general security around the outside of the building. So far all the cameras are still working. I have 6 installed and connected to the Reolink NVR. Difficult to get the motion detection setup just right so the NVR records more often that I would like but that is the only negative so far.
customer_reviews.author: Wrenchbender13

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use, high performance
customer_reviews.text: My elderly parents have a cabin that they would like to enjoy the view from, even when they're not there. I tried a webcam a few years ago, but it proved to have a challenging UI. The ReoLink was a walk in the park. My parents enjoyed it immediately; they love being able to see what's happening not only on their PCs, but also their cell phones. It's worth pointing out that we've been able to make the ReoLink client work on Windows PC, Macintosh, iPhone, and Android phone. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: seattlenerd

customer_reviews.title: Solid inexpensive camera with a terrible mount
customer_reviews.text: Nice camera with a good picture. The setup is easier than most. Picture is good. The only problem is the flimsy plastic mount. Be sure the mounting surface is flat and it shouldn't be too bad. I installed it on some older fencing and the wood was a bit warped and the plastic ring would not work because of the warp. Had to use a flatter mounting piece and then it worked OK. Still not ideal, but the camera works well.
customer_reviews.author: Panamint

customer_reviews.title: Super happy with this camera.
customer_reviews.text: I shopped quite a bit before going with this camera. There are so many confusing options out there it's really difficult to decide. I finally just decided to order one and go from there and in really happy with my decision. This camera is amazing for the money. Will be buying more in the future. Update: after first rain and camera mounted under cover the lens got moisture inside the lens. I have sent for a replacement and hoping it was an isolated issue.
customer_reviews.author: RLF

customer_reviews.title: Easy Installation, great video quality
customer_reviews.text: This product had an excellent "box to function" experience. This was made possible, in part, to employing power over ethernet. Great value for money. Will buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you're looking for easier to configure, this is your camera
customer_reviews.text: The hardest part for me mostly was physically installing the cameras and CAT5 cabling. Once I got them installed and connected them to a POE switch, it was super intuitive to configure. Practically plug and play, and the best part is the built in micro sd card slot on each camera means no need for a separate nvr. Install the app, scan the qr code on each camera, input some simple settings for email notifications and you're live.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Solved it's purpose!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? Solved it's purpose! The second day after the camera installation, a thief stole a package from my entrance door. I made a Police report and I uploaded 3 pics to Facebook, shared publicly and waited. Next day I received information about the thief, also Police were informed. Two days later, a criminal investigator picked up surveillance video and commented on the good quality. I'm glad with that purchase especially with the discounted price. I wish to have another 3-4 cameras with Reolink NVR.
customer_reviews.author: Norbert

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to get an Amcrest outdoor camera to match another IP camera I have inside. This was a much better price so I decided to give it a try. I was able to get the camera installed in less than 20 minutes and as soon as I started the app it found the camera. Much easier setup and better app than Amcrest. It's very easy to watch saved clips on the app. The only downside is you can't use their cloud service with this model yet, but I was planning on using a micro SD card anyway so that was ok for me.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Solid basic camera for BlueIris
customer_reviews.text: It’s hard to fault this solid, if somewhat dated. Video quality is quite good during the day, and very usable at night. It would be nice if they updated the design to include h.265 support. While making the camera easy to connect, I am not a fan of the UID function that allows external connection through a NAT router - but the feature is easily disabled. I’ve purchased multiple for BlueIris and they work well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Apprehensive in getting this as I wanted to pair it with a Amcrest NV4108 NVR. Works great - night vision is simply great. I had ordered some amcrest 4K dome cameras - not impressed with night vision - the 420 simply much better night vision. Haven't tried the motion detection as its not a requirement for me... so if you wondered if this will pair up with Amcrest/Dahua - worked fine in my case.. BTW I also ordered the 422 - all indications so far it works great with the Amcrest NVR
customer_reviews.author: Rui R.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Chinese Camera
customer_reviews.text: There is currently no firmware upgrade for this camera. 05/20/2019 You have a choice of running really high 5M video resolutions (2560x1960) or really low resolutions (640x480). But no standard old (1920x1080) Which I thought was not clear on the Amazon page for this camera. So you tend to run the higher resolutions. Streaming all these extra pixels uses a ton extra bandwidth. So when you server slows way down after adding one camera, don't say I didn't warn you! Try HikVison cameras...
customer_reviews.author: Bro

customer_reviews.title: Camera appears to have a moisture leak - cloudy picture
customer_reviews.text: The camera had a great image for the first hour it was plugged in but then after temps dropped the picture became cloudy. It appears that a seal isn't sealing and is allowing moisture into the camera. Purchased new. Have used many REO link products and have had a few cameras that needed to be replaced and a dead hard drive after about 10 months. When they work they work well but seems quality control could be improved.
customer_reviews.author: Southern Realtor

customer_reviews.title: Good, integrates with everything.
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I love this camera. Not only does it support Onvif, but RTSP meaning it will work with all sorts of camera software. I use Home Assistant and a Hiseeu NVR. Image quality 4/5 but 3/5 at night. You can adjust color exposure and contrast in the web portal or app. Highly recommend for home automation geeks. Wasn't so hard to mount, is adjustable, include an Ethernet cable and instructions. You won't see licence plate that well, but if you want that they make higher end cameras. I personally don't know how it compares to the competition, but seems like good value.
customer_reviews.author: Sh4n3

customer_reviews.title: GARBAGE. SAVE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: it does not record to micro sd card. tried several different cards with different capacity. reset the camera over 10x. spent 1/2 day and no reolink support. guess the ceo likes swimming in money from crappy products than to help the customer base. no wonder it was on sale. sell off the defective camera and hope no one finds out
customer_reviews.author: SWEN

customer_reviews.title: PTZ to add to my NVR
customer_reviews.text: I needed a PTZ camera to add to my 5MB ReoLink NVR system and this works very well. Once powered on, you need to setup this PTZ camera first before adding it to the NVR. The easiest way to set it up was through a downloaded client software to my laptop (mac or windows) to find, register, and add the NVR and cameras together. The NVR automatically finds it, BUT you want to configure at least a password to your C2 Pro.
customer_reviews.author: David W

customer_reviews.title: Good quality camera
customer_reviews.text: Setup and install was easy. Just be careful that you seal up wiring connection. A little moisture will kill a camera. I learned this the hard way when I pressure washed my house. One of my bullet cameras died because of this. Totally on me! It's a good idea to seal up the connectors with electrical tape for extra protection.
customer_reviews.author: Richard G.

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly in my Reolink System
customer_reviews.text: What's not to like? It works like the bullet cameras but is obviously a dome camera. Less intrusive than a bullet camera, it's easy to aim and the video quality is excellent whether during the day or at night. I'm rating the motion detection as 5-stars because it interoperates with the Reolink NVR as advertised (though that system has its own limitations).
customer_reviews.author: ILikeAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Added to Our Reolink System
customer_reviews.text: Though not a PTZ camera, it has a nice wide fisheye that allows us to watch three different doors in our house. We have another Reolink, and this cam added to the apps and desktop system easily. It also works with our Synology RAID and our Alarm.com accounts. We like the Reolink cameras, especially the night vision quality.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher S. Wyatt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent & Easy
customer_reviews.text: I moved from an Arlo / Nest Camera "security system" hybrid ReoLink and have been nothing but impressed. We have 5, 4mp REOLink Cameras surrounding the house (Reolink 4MP 8CH PoE Video Surveillance System +1 additional camera), and I purchased the additional 5mp for my front drive and street view. Wow - the clarity is amazing and stands out over the 4mp cameras. The system overall is great, the only thing I wish it had was notifications and ease-of-app use like Nest / Arlo, but that is by no means saying the ReoLink app is bad, it just simply has so many more options that it can be overwhelming to know where to go to find X,Y,Z. All-in-all, excellent system!
customer_reviews.author: Jdnanne

customer_reviews.title: This is a hard no!
customer_reviews.text: Simply put, you get what you pay for. Using with Blue Iris and Ryzen 7 based server. This camera will not maintain any sort of steady frame rate and overall picture quality is severely lacking. Frame rates vary from 0-19 and average around 2. Pretty unacceptable for my needs. Overall, highly disappointed but I had to try it at the price point. I'll stick with my Dahua cameras that are always quality and reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent POE Camera
customer_reviews.text: I used the POE ethernet connection and this camera has worked flawlessly. The picture appears clearly almost instantly on my mobile phone every time. I can clearly hear what is happening and the camera records motion events on it's SD Card without loading the network. It has a prerecord function so it captures a few seconds before and event so it's easy to see what is happening. It only uses the network bandwidth when queried and the app is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Reader

customer_reviews.title: Excellent picture, easy install
customer_reviews.text: We already have several of these cameras installed, just adding 1 more. Excellent picture quality. Plug-n-Play install (to the Reolink Network Video Recorder (NVR)). The only hard part is running the Ethernet cables (these are PoE, not wireless). Cables don't come with the camera (but cables come with the NVR system). Since these are PoE (power over Ethernet), you don't need power at the camera, just plug in the Ethernet cable. Power comes from the NVR. Couldn't be simpler.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, stupid cables
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Easy setup and menus Great image Great price Works well with Blue Iris Cons: Stupid cables hanging off the camera for power and reset when all you need is a single Ethernet port for a POE camera. Mount is not secure - no set screw. Cannot reduce image size to 1920 x 1080.
customer_reviews.author: Mad Martian

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality, Tons of Features
customer_reviews.text: The image quality from this Camera is fantastic. This camera essentially has an NVR Built into it, the amount of features and different ways to save footage, at this price point is unbelievable. The Micro SD card slot was the reason I bought this camera, it allows you to record locally and then off-load footage to another location, thus not relying on your internet connection being up 100% of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Airola

customer_reviews.title: Nice option
customer_reviews.text: I needed this and it popped up on a flash sale. PERFECT Timing! I ordered it on Tuesday and it arrived Wednesday morning. Impressive! Plugged it into the Reolink NVR and it worked without any further tinkering. That is a plus. May buy another as it has a wider feild of view than the standard cameras.
customer_reviews.author: N. Keith

customer_reviews.title: So easy and so important.
customer_reviews.text: I use this to monitor my aquarium. Simple to use and the app for your fruit phone works great. I can check on my fish and the thermometer that is in my field of view. I once needed someone to check in daily, but now I can contact them for any assistance. Great product and so simple to setup and monitor remote by my cell.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Something else needed to power it, description says no.
customer_reviews.text: Says, “ Poe outdoor and indoor: PoE with only one Ethernet cable (up to 330ft), No power adapter needed, optional PoE switch or injector, easy setup with plug and play, waterproof camera, fit for indoor and outdoor, residential areas, retail store, business.” and yet something else is needed to power it. Why lie?
customer_reviews.author: David Stiles

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Great Camera and easily installed on my Reolink NVR System. I gave 4 stars because it only came with a 3 ft ethernet cable. I am not sure where you would mount this POE camera w/in 3 feet of the NVR. The complete NVR system and cameras came with 60ft cables. Overall, I am happy with the system.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Expected better
customer_reviews.text: The camera came as described and worked fine for the first 3 days. Then, every three hours or so it loses connection even though it’s plugged in to my Poe switch. Have to reset it every time. Kind of a bummer for what I was expecting from Reolink
customer_reviews.author: Cheyne

customer_reviews.title: Good camera but doesnt work with my DVR/NVR
customer_reviews.text: What I liked is that It was priced ok, works well, very clear image quality. What I didnt like is that It didnnt work fully with my DVR/NVR. It could be that the DVR is selecting its own manufacturer (proprietary monopoly?). I ended up keeping it on my shelf for using some day as its quite a good camera overall.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Well Worth the Price
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Easy to install, easy to configure on iOS and Mac. Wish Mac had push notifications but can't win them all. Picks up motion and sends push notification to my iOS device within a second or 2 every single time. Good picture quality in daytime and night. Should have bought these sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Really reolink? A 1 meter cord?
customer_reviews.text: Great picture quality, sound is crisp, lots of features, the only thing that makes no sense is they give your a 1m cord to hook to the dvr? Who puts their outdoor camera 1m from the dvr? The 4 camera system ironically comes with 4 15ft cat5 cords with it which is what I'm going to end up getting instead of everything separate
customer_reviews.author: monica

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: This was an add on to my system. Ran Ethernet under the ground to my shed. Now the whole property is covered. I got this camera for 44 dollars. You can’t beat the price. They are easy to install if you are just a little bit handy. My only complaint is that they are a little sensitive and bugs can set them off. Not a big deal as I have them recording 24/7 with a NVR system.
customer_reviews.author: TB

customer_reviews.title: For the price - this is awesome
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my whole 720p system with this brand. I bought this unit for front door and can't be happier. wide field of view, excellent night optics. For this price, this is a very good PoE camera. I've had for about 1 month, will revise if any problems...
customer_reviews.author: Reads a bit of everything

customer_reviews.title: Very good camera
customer_reviews.text: Very good, high quality build. Easy mounting on porch ceiling. Using with PoE Cat6 cabling. Set up with iSpy surveillance software was quick and easy. Very high quality video stream.May replace other, older cameras with this brand in the future. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: hb

customer_reviews.title: Using with Synology SurveillanceStation
customer_reviews.text: I'm using (3) Reolink RLC-420-5MP cameras, along with the (3) Reolink RLC-410-5MP with Synology SurveillanceStation. I have them configured to use generic ONVIF. I've had no issues problems, although getting the cover back on after mounting was a bit of a pain. It would be nice to have H.265, but I have plenty of network bandwidth, so not really a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Good product, I recommend it
customer_reviews.text: Camera worked well. It was fairly clear, although I'd hoped for it to be clearer I think that's how most 5MP cameras are I guess. App worked well although it took time to get used to. For quality and price it's a good product. I intend to buy a dozen more to go with our NVR and commercial use.
customer_reviews.author: MukilteoCat

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a basic system ..
customer_reviews.text: Best camera system for the price!! Accomplishes what we need... but if you are going to want great detail like a license plate on car etc... then you will need the more expensive camera. System and app is fairly easy to set up once you learn the nuances of the motion detection etc...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product / Excellent Tech Support
customer_reviews.text: Thank you I really appreciate your help and rapid respond to my needs, this is what I call customer service (support) I will recommend this brand to my family and friends, an I will keep buying from Reolink. Thank you very much .
customer_reviews.author: Grita

customer_reviews.title: Quality picture
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Reolink security system that came with 4 Poe 5mp turret cameras and one camera was from the start kinda funky like it would have video loss for no reason. I bought this one camera the replace the funky one. The first one I bought was a dud, didn’t turn on at all so I requested a replacement and it was here the next day super fast Thankyou for that. The new one works great I would recommend this system to anybody that wants a quality system with high quality cameras he pictures are really clear
customer_reviews.author: benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Picture quality beautiful
customer_reviews.text: We use this camera outside under our eaves by the garage. The way our house is situated we can never see if anyone is in our driveway. The picture quality is super and we can see at least 3 blocks down the street. I want to order another one for the other side of the garage.
customer_reviews.author: Anitacs

customer_reviews.title: Good camera
customer_reviews.text: I like Reolink cameras. All of the cameras I use are Reolinks. This was my first 5MP camera. The picture quality is astounding. Even the night vision looks good. It is very easy to configure and the mounting is extremely secure.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for simple security.
customer_reviews.text: Installation is very simple: 50ft Ethernet cable > POE injector > cable box. The app allows you to adjust the motion area so I was able to filter out the flag movement in view. Notifications for any movement straight to your phone is nice. You can also add multiple users for access. Picture quality is good especially on the 5mp option. Overall very nice for what I was looking for. Something to watch over the front of the house and alert me when I’m not expecting anyone. Only downside are the fastening screws. Two broke and one bent while mounting the bracket.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Easiest set up ever
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through a lot of cameras. We use them in our goat barn to monitor the animals especially during kidding season. I have to say I have never had a camera easier to set up that this. As soon as I plugged it in and it initialized, the app recognized it and added it to the stream, literally less than 2 minutes. The construction is solid and I am excited to add more to the network.
customer_reviews.author: DMC

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Quite impressed by the feel of the camera when it arrived - I had expected lighter quality, instead found a solid feel of primarily metal frame to protect the camera. Really quick and easy setup, works well with my existing NVR software but also find the Reolink app responsive and easy to navigate. Very good 5MP image and video quality. And for the price, I'm impressed with what I got. Most comparable cameras I found going for significantly more. Had to pose a question to Support as the website isn't the easiest to navigate, but Support was able to answer my questions and overall had a great experience.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: A solid and functional camera with great image quality
customer_reviews.text: The camera unit was a little bulkier than I expected, but it is a very well built and solid unit. Super easy to setup with the ReoLink app but also works really well with OpenSource monitoring applications like MotionEye. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Stephen Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Very nice camera. I already had the 4 camera system for a year now and these systems work great. Definition is perfect and night vision looks good. I added this on to look over my driveway. Quality and price are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: KayDubYa

customer_reviews.title: Great CAM
customer_reviews.text: We purchased to have above front door, and to be able to see on our TV. Easy to adjust and mount, we are able to capture the front door & yard, and across the street. The audio is works very well. Great camera for the price.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: exceptional quality and prompt support when needed
customer_reviews.text: The Reolink 420 5mp cams have a combination of high image quality, built-in video stream, windows client and smartphone software, and great support staff to answer your questions and problems. On top of all that, the cam only costs $60, much cheaper than competitive cameras. I was skeptical at first, but it clearly is a better product than others and costs less.
customer_reviews.author: Allen M.

customer_reviews.title: wrong review
customer_reviews.text: the review I made was not for this, but for another seller that was mistakenly made in your column, to be clear, I do have this camera and it works great, the dome ones are better for keeping spider's way.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Tr

customer_reviews.title: Best Quality at unbeatable price
customer_reviews.text: I've been using another bullet reolink camera for over a year now without any issues, so I decided to get this new 5MP dome camera to capture my front porch activity. The picture is crystal clear, and setup was easy. I just scanned the barcode of the camera with the phone app and it found it right away. These cameras easily show up in my Synology NAS secure station app as well. Can't go wrong, especially for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: not sure if something was wrong with mine
customer_reviews.text: But I have a REO camera the bullet style and that one has no problems. This one you can't see the entire FOV. the distance for night vision is not as what is listed and not as bright. During the day it seems fine. Bad at night.
customer_reviews.author: frank

customer_reviews.title: Great picture and recording
customer_reviews.text: This is the 5th REOLINK camera I've installed and have been through a number of other brands. I love the quality, video recording and playback. For the money it is the best. And the app is easy to use, especially playing back recordings.
customer_reviews.author: Ken S.

customer_reviews.title: Great experience with support
customer_reviews.text: The camera has all the features I wanted and picture quality was very good for the price. I lost a little part with install (black insert) and contacted Reolink support to see if I could purchase a replacement. They are sending me one free of charge.
customer_reviews.author: James Clapper

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp imaged Security Camera
customer_reviews.text: Quick and easy to install. Works well. Issue with POE with my old switch but purchased a compatible 12 V DC adapter from TMEZON and it works great. Would purchase from REOLINK again. APP and PC Client work well
customer_reviews.author: S E Morris

customer_reviews.title: Great camera.
customer_reviews.text: Nice camera excellent picture and ease of setup. I use this with Zoneminder and it works perfectly. I will gradually replace my exisiting cameras when they start to fail with Reolink
customer_reviews.author: J. Gehrman

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: Great picture but my only complaint is that when you try enlarging the picture it's not as sharp. I would buy the cameras with the 4x optical zoom, which I may purchase as add-ons. Great quality and look good, too.
customer_reviews.author: barnarra

customer_reviews.title: Image quality OK. Motion alert is not implemented well.
customer_reviews.text: The image quality is OK. But motion detection is useless. It apparently detects motion by changes in pixels. I have blocked out everything except my driveway. When the tree shadows on the driveway move you get a motion alert. When the sun goes behind clouds you get a motion alert. If a leaf blows by you get a motion alert. I could go on and on. Motion alert is important to me, so I am returning....
customer_reviews.author: Joan Florence

customer_reviews.title: Major Software Issues
customer_reviews.text: The basics (Picture quality, Motion detection, IR lights) all are good for the price of this camera. Where its lacking is a reliable software to run the camera. You'll try to connect to the camera about a dozen times without linking up to it. Restart the program and cross your fingers and hope that it will link up. Maybe if you hooked this to a DVR it would work more reliably due to possibly a different software but I don't know as I'm just using this as a stand alone single camera unit.
customer_reviews.author: Kade Poorman

customer_reviews.title: Amazing picture
customer_reviews.text: I've now bought a total of 8 of these for my NVR. They're all great cameras. Night vision is way better than I was thinking it would be. Easy to install and with POE its nice to have a single Ethernet transmitting data and power.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Voss

customer_reviews.title: Good Image and ability to scan through playback
customer_reviews.text: Good Image and ability to scan through playback. It would be nice to have a quick scroll on playback like video software does! so you can scroll through and scan quick and easy forward and back, and be able to see
customer_reviews.author: gravydog

customer_reviews.title: These cameras are awesome
customer_reviews.text: So simple to set up, really great camera system for the price, and the app for remote viewing is great! I've installed 12 of these cameras thus far and will most likely buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Wong Dock

customer_reviews.title: Great PoE option
customer_reviews.text: PoE makes it extremely easy to set up. The RTSP connection is great to use with other software. The Reolink software is good too, but video based motion detection makes outdoor use a little hard. Moving leaves or shadows can set the motion alarm off.
customer_reviews.author: Aggie

customer_reviews.title: Good Cheap Camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for use in my garage. I connected it to my Blue Iris system pretty easily and had it up any working in no time! Had to adjust the format for recording to keep it running at a decent rate because It was crashing my system at first, but after changing it the performance is great!
customer_reviews.author: tbuff1

customer_reviews.title: Reolink rlc520 5 MP Poe camera
customer_reviews.text: Great easy to setup. Plug and play Can use with NVR or alone plugged to router with reolink app or reolink client. Can be updated via reolink site
customer_reviews.author: Blessed

customer_reviews.title: Works great but
customer_reviews.text: Works great but with it recording 24/7 I can’t figure out to get Reolink program to record over old video files. I have it connected to a PC and it keeps filling up my storage space.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Not supported with there own cloud service!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Did not like their idea of easy plug and play with cutting the wire for waterproofing. rlc-420 camera doesn't work with their cloud service, think that should have been stated in the first paragraph that was a big selling point for my buying it .
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Very good Products, easy to install, Good customer service
customer_reviews.text: I have bought total 9 to 10 Reolink Cameras. So far those cameras are working great. One of cameras had some issues, but passed the return period. I email the customer services and they had a very quick response and replaced the camera without any problem. The software is also very easy to use. Over all great product!
customer_reviews.author: Ji Li

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: We've been using Reolink for a couple of years now and have never had an issue. For the price you won't find anything better.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd S.

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised  Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the RLK8-520 D4-5mp 8mp/4K-8 channel NVR 2TB HDD. It was easy to install and setup. The NVR has a lot of features that are simple to use. Customer Service was great. Had an issue with one camera and they replaced it very quickly. They were very helpful. It came with 4 cameras and I purchased and additional 520 to add to the 8 channel NVR.
customer_reviews.author: T E

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, great price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these cameras to replace other defective cameras. I have a 32 camera GW system and the new cameras worked great using onvif settings. I love the Reolink software as it made setup a breeze. I definitely recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: REOLINK PoE IP Camera Outdoor 5MP HD Video Surveillance Work with Google Assistant, Audio IR Night Vision Motion Detection SD Card Slot, RLC-520
feature_bullets: 5MP Poe Camera with 100ft Night Vision: This PoE IP camera with 18 infrared LEDs,enabling 65-100ft long-distance night vision range and up to 80˚ wide viewing angle,captures more clearer and sharper images and video,which is great for driveway,hallways.

Free App and Remote Access: Work with Google Assistant,this poe security cameras can live stream to your TV in real-time using simple voice-activated commands. Rich feature in Reolink free apps for iPhone, Android, Windows PC, Mac with no subscription fee.

PoE Camera Outdoor and Indoor: PoE security camera wired with only one Ethernet cable (up to 330ft), plug and play easy setup for optional PoE switch or injector. This waterproof PoE dome camera fit for indoor and outdoor, residential areas, retail store.

Smart Motion Detect and Alert: The PoE security camera has flexible motion detection (set detection zone, schedule detection time and adjust sensibility) and real-time and accurate movement alert via app push notification or email.

Sound Recording and 24x7 NVR Recording: Built-in microphone enables sound recording; Work with REOLINK PoE network video recorders, which would support 24x7 HD video recording and storage up to 16 PoE surveillance cameras with built-in 3TB HDD.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars653 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
